page.title: 07Carlisle Great Fair (i)
page.content: This was revived in the 1970's mainly to encourage tourism but also to give a focus to the activities of local societies.It is organised by a comm- ittee of unpaid enthusiasts. The first Great Fair was granted in a charter of Edward III in 1352; it is proclaimed by the Chief Executive (formerly the Town Clerk) from the steps of Carlisle Cross at 8.00a.m. on 26 August in a civic ceremony. The most visible parts of the Fair are the open-air street market, with stall holders in approximately Victorian costume; live entertainment on the temporary stage outside the Old Town Hall (with traffic diverted); and a parade of decorated floats on the Saturday afternoon. In the evenings local societies and professional promotions compete for an audience. {(see p.8) >>}
